intro: Stylidium diuroides subsp. nanum, commonly known as the dwarf sun-orchid, is a small, herbaceous plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Haemodoraceae, which includes several species of flowering plants found in arid and semi-arid regions. The plant is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and small, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in spring. It is adapted to thrive in sandy or rocky soils and requires full sun exposure. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
